qas.question: What kind of error was found in Twilight Princess for Wii?

What was the name of the hack discovered?

context: Following the discovery of a <a0_0><b6_0>buffer overflow vulnerability<b6_0/><a0_0/> in the Wii version of Twilight Princess, an exploit known as the "<a3_0><b9_0>Twilight Hack<b9_0/><a3_0/>" was developed, allowing the execution of custom code from a Secure Digital (SD) card on the console. A properly designed save file would cause the game to load unsigned code, which could include <a1_0><b7_0>Executable and Linkable Format<b7_0/><a1_0/> (ELF) programs and homebrew Wii applications. Versions <a4_0>3.3 and 3.4<a4_0/> of the Wii Menu prevented copying exploited save files onto the console until circumvention methods were discovered, and version <a2_0><a5_0><b8_0><b10_0>4.0<b10_0/><b8_0/><a5_0/><a2_0/> of the Wii Menu patched the vulnerability.
